name: wizzwizz4
text:
@roytang Pretty much none of the backend developments are good. The frontend developments that are actually for websites? Service workers (sometimes), some new HTML elements, ARIA… that's it. Frameworks are a lie.

CSS is the only webdev thing that's actually hard (source: I'm the person my friends go to when they need CSS expertise, and I can usually answer from memory, yet I don't know enough CSS to make a website), and it's one of the least valued skills.

Testing indeed doesn't exist.
